node.title: 101-year old Irene credits her longevity to plain food, but draws the line at bread and dripping
node.alt: Irene standing infront of a bookshelf wearing pearls.
node.description: The fiercely independentÂ centenarian credits her longevity to a good diet, and says visits from Meals on Wheels ensure she's never lonely.
node.content:
["Even after all these years, the thought of bread and dripping makes 101-year old Irene Loveland shudder.", "It was one of the limited staples available during the Great Depression in the early 1930s \u2014\u00a0and Mrs Loveland clearly remembers the feeling of being hungry.", "\"We had bread and dripping with salt. I can't bear the thought of it these days, but when you're hungry, you can eat it,\" Mrs Loveland said.", "Self-described as fiercely independent, the centenarian will turn 102 just before Christmas and credits her long life to good, plain food and keeping active.", "She also counts herself lucky to be surrounded by a supportive family, and a range of services such as\u00a0Meals on Wheels that allow her to stay in her own home.", "\"I don't get lonely, there's always something to do,\" she said.", "\"If you stay in your own home, you've got to keep doing a job and sitting down, but by doing that you use parts of your body you wouldn't use otherwise. If you sit in your chair and do nothing, that's as far as you'll ever get.\"\u00a0", "", "
While Meals on Wheels\u00a0now have a \"waiting list\" to volunteer after struggling with participation during the pandemic.(ABC News: Michael Lloyd)
", "At the nearby Sunnybank hub for Meals on Wheels on Brisbane's south side, the organisation's Queensland president Roslyn Broom regards their home-visiting program as equally important to the meal service.", "She said it started in response to a\u00a0growing\u00a0demand.", "\"They just needed the company, so now we visit clients every day of the week.\"", "Ms Broom said it is also an opportunity for volunteers to link up clients with other services if they see\u00a0a need not being met.", "Volunteer Chris Seen said Mrs Loveland was one of his favourite clients to visit, and that he is in awe of her health and attitude to life.", "\"She's probably one of our only clients who has\u00a0no dietary requirements, she just orders directly from the menu,\" Mr Seen said.", "", "
Chris Seen joined Meals on Wheels as a volunteer when he heard they needed help during the pandemic.\u00a0(ABC News: Michael Lloyd)
", "Dropping off a serving of lasagne for dinner and strawberry mousse for dessert, Mr Seen said he signed up to do deliveries when he heard Meals on Wheels had been losing volunteers during the pandemic.", "\"I heard that they were losing people and it was a time when they needed people the most.", "\"I do it because the experiences\u00a0and life stories they have to share are just so fascinating and it just keeps you in touch with what their journey has been, and some have got some remarkable stories to share,\" Mr Seen said.", "", "
Meals on Wheels Queensland President Roslyn Broom and Peter Chaffey in the organisation's Sunnybank hub.(ABC News: Michael Lloyd)
", "
From volunteer shortage to\u00a0overload
", "Ms Broom said Meals on Wheels Sunnybank lost 10 full-time volunteers during the height of the pandemic, which had been stressful for\u00a0the organisation.", "\"It was mainly drivers that we were short, but now we've got a waiting list, so that's extra special \u2013 we can't fit them all in anymore!\"", "Ms Broom herself has dedicated the past 27 years to Meals on Wheels, and watched it grow to a mammoth organisation in that time.", "", "
Sharon Oberhart started volunteering at Meals on Wheels after losing her mother earlier this year.\u00a0
", "Sharon Oberhardt is another volunteer who recently joined the Sunnybank kitchen full-time.", "When she lost her mother earlier in the year\u00a0she promised herself she would volunteer in her memory.", "\"I used to care for my Mum, and we got some meals for her from here, and I always thought it would be nice that I'd come in and volunteer to this very kitchen,\" Ms Oberhardt said.", "\"She died in April, and I took a little while to get myself back together before I started coming in September, and it's a great family here I love it.\"", "It is estimated that across the country, 76,000 volunteers help\u00a0deliver meals to 200,000 older and vulnerable Australians."]
